profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Olive Ross, 1955, and Robert Hofstadter, 1992.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Webster Hansen Papers (SC0004). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: William Webster Hansen was Professor of Physics and Director of the Microwave Laboratory at Stanford University, 1929-1949.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Hansen's professional and research papers include correspondence, manuscripts, research notebooks, lecture notes, unpublished studies and notes on various experiments and scientific developments such as radar, the rhumbatron, the klystron, radiation and microwave mechanics. Also included are Hansen's account of the development of the klystron tube, reports of the first linear accelerator at Stanford, his M.I.T. lectures on microwave physics, patents, scrapbooks, and photographs.
